name: YouTube: moar vertical space in feeds
description: stops the header bars from sticking to the top of the screen when you scroll down on feed pages (home, trending, and subscriptions). hides the tab bar completely on the subscriptions page, since i rarely use it to switch to home or trending. note: this is for the old YouTube design and will not work for the 2017 Material redesign.

additional_info:
changes: 2016-05-18: change name of style from "hide What to Watch / My Subscriptions bar" to "moar vertical space in YouTube feeds"
  • now stops the header bars from sticking to the top of the screen when you scroll down on all 3 feed pages (home, trending, and subscriptions) in addition to also hiding the tab bar completely on the subscriptions page
  • now applies to URLs with parameters (like https://www.youtube.com/feed/subscriptions?flow=2)
